text: Srobotnik pri Velikih Laščah () is a small village southeast of Velike Lašče in central Slovenia. The entire Municipality of Velike Lašče is part of the traditional region of Lower Carniola and is now included in the Central Slovenia Statistical Region.Velike Lašče municipal site ==Name== The name of the settlement was changed from Srobotnik to Srobotnik pri Velikih Laščah in 1953.Spremembe naselij 1948–95. 1996. Database. Ljubljana: Geografski inštitut ZRC SAZU, DZS. ==Church== The local church, built on a small hill northwest of the main settlement, is dedicated to Saint Roch and belongs to the Parish of Velike Lašče. It was commissioned in 1624 by the owner of Ortnek Castle Krištof Moškon (Count Mosconi). It was rebuilt in 1731 and again in 1875.Slovenian Ministry of Culture register of national heritage reference number ešd 2643 During the Second World War, it was targeted by Partisan mortars on 28 February 1944.Kladnik, Tomaž. "Obramba vojaških postojank Slovenskega domobranstva." Prispevki za novejšo zgodovino 46(2): 41–61, pp. 53, 56. During the attack, the main altar was burned, together with a painting by Anton Postl from 1770. The church was restored in the 1970s. ==References== ==External links== *Srobotnik pri Velikih Laščah on Geopedia Category:Populated places in the Municipality of Velike Lašče
title: Srobotnik pri Velikih Laščah
